description: {"blocks":[{"key":"403fc","text":"This protocol describes the steps necessary to extract and purify genomic DNA from dermatophytes (and more specifically from dermatophytes of the genus Trichophyton).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"201gn","text":"Perform the DNA dosage directly after extraction and not after a freeze/thaw cycle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6tpd8","text":"Be careful when preparing the medium : work under sterile conditions as much as possible to avoid contaminating the liquid medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cci92","text":"After allowing to cool, transfer   of this medium into a tube. {"blocks":[{"key":"69n88","text":"Using a sterile swab (or a sterile inoculation loop), gently collect the primary culture and dip the swab (or the sterile inoculation loop) into the tube containing the culture medium (prepared in the previous step). Close the tube halfway to allow gas exchange. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a8qss","text":"Allow to grow in the incubator at   until a sufficient flocculate is formed (requires at least 96 hours). Incubation time varies from strain to strain but flocculate should be visible after 5 days. If this is not the case, repeat the cultivation step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"CC18FDA0AC5F11EC82F60A58A9FEAC02","id":"49403","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"30","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1k3va","text":"Using a Pasteur pipette, carefully remove the flocculate from the tube containing the previously cultured dermatophyte strain. Transfer this flocculate to a sterile tube containing glass beads, let's call it primary tube. {"blocks":[{"key":"3n80d","text":"Cool this tube to    on the ice block for  . Then, heat this tube in a water bath at   for  . Finally, run this tube through the cell disruptor at maximum speed for  . This constitutes 1 cycle of 3 steps. You must repeat this cycle 5 times. {"blocks":[{"key":"it3a","text":"Add   of absolute ethanol (96-100%), vortex for    and then short-spin centrifuge for MAXIMUM   at    to accelerate protein precipitation. {"blocks":[{"key":"282mm","text":"Gently collect the supernatant of the solution (approximately  ) then apply it in the chromatographic column with the silica membrane.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":62,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"600","error":false,"guid":"F96D2AB0AC5F11EC82F60A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

Keep the column and discard the flows-through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":25,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":32,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"01BD7BBFAC6011EC82F60A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"11000","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"01BD7D15AC6011EC82F60A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"11000","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"31lpm","text":"Discard the flows-through or change the collection tube and centrifuge the column at    for    without adding any buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":85,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":92,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"0C41F3E0AC6011EC82F60A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"11000","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"0C41F49DAC6011EC82F60A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"11000","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5nvef","text":"Incubate for    at room temperature and then centrifuge for   at   Discard the column and keep the flows-though which is the purified DNA. Store DNA at   to ensure stability.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":60,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":65,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":152,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"1A95737DAC6011EC82F60A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"1A957416AC6011EC82F60A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"1A9574DDAC6011EC82F60A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"11000","start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"1A9575A8AC6011EC82F60A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"shaker":"11000","start":null,"temperature":"-80","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9trec","text":"To determine the purity and concentration of the DNA, a NanoDrop dosage was performed. For this purpose, a negative control was prepared beforehand. This control will have undergone all the extraction steps but will not contain any material from dermatophytes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4f236","text":"Launch the computer program and select the \"nucleic acid\" mode. Make sure the sample deposit spot is clean and dry. If necessary, clean it with the wipes provided for this purpose. Then drop    of the negative control and click on the \"blank\" box.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":191,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ed4po","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"3E794390D46611ECA77815EF27A18B56","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fg2u5","text":"Proceed in the same way to measure the sample containing the DNA, but click on \"measure\" instead of \"blank\". There is no need to redo a blank between measurements.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
